CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 5 reads: " "Y" Drive Quota-Busters - Quote busters in recent Centre Avenue YMCA membership drive proved real sparkplugs in the annual campaign by an institution dedicated to building character in young men. Left to right, front row: Mrs. James M. Burgette, Mrs. Sara Robinson, co-boss of the women's division; Boyd L. Wilson, a big boss of the campaign; Mrs. Ceola Jones and William Albea, who headed the winning ranch group, and William H. Coleman, co-boss of the Yellow Circle Ranch.  Second row: Atty. George Shields, chairman of the branch's committee of management.  Rear row: Frank E. Bolden, highest producer among the men; Russell Washington, foreman; Paul E. Thompson, Dr. Richard Turfley, Frank Lavelle, foreman, and J.D. Lewis. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, front row from left: Mrs. James M. Burgette, Sara Robinson, Boyd L. Wilson, Ceola Jones, William Albea, and William H. Coleman; second row: Atty. George Shields; third row: Frank E. Bolden, Russell Washington, Paul E. Thompson, Dr. Richard Turfley, Frank Lavelle, and J.D. Lewis, gathered around sofa in YMCA with Henry O.Tanner painting "Christ and His Mother"
